intro: Psychotria estrellana var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It often grows in humid, shaded environments within montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
